intro: Diolena boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian diolena, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense, colorful heads. Diolena boliviensis is noted for its ecological importance as a source of nectar for pollinators in its native range.
